para.heading: In general.
para.text: Before any person, firm, or corporation shall hereafter engage or continue to engage in the work or business of a master or maintenance electrician in Baltimore City, as defined in this subtitle, such person, firm or corporation shall apply to the Board for a license, and the Board shall provide the applicant with the prescribed forms.

para.heading: Exceptions.
para.text: This section shall not apply to any person, firm or corporation engaged in the repair and maintenance of electrical appliances and electrical home utilities insofar as making minor adjustments and repairs necessary in connection with the installation and repair of electrical appliances and utilities.

para.heading: Age.
para.text: Applicants must be at least 21 years old.

para.heading: Experience — general.
para.text: An applicant for examination for a master electrician license shall have been regularly and principally employed or engaged in electrical construction, maintenance, installation and repair of all types of electrical equipment and apparatus, all coming within the purview of and subject to all provisions of this subtitle, for a period of not less than 7 years preceding the date of his application, under the direction and supervision of a master electrician, 3 years of which he supervised or was actively in charge of the electrical installation work.

para.heading: Experience — credit for schooling.
para.text: The Board may credit the maximum of 3 years for formal course study or professional training in electrical installation which, in the opinion of the Board, provided comparable experience in training otherwise attainable under the supervision of a master electrician or while employed by a government agency.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: The application shall be filed with the Board at least 30 days prior to the examination months.

para.heading: False statements.
para.text: A false, erroneous, or misleading statement made in an application is cause for rejection of the application or revocation of a license issued to the applicant.

para.heading: Authorized.
para.text: Any person whose application for license shall have been rejected by the Board shall have the right to appeal to a board of arbitration, which shall consist of 1 person selected by the person making the appeal, 1 person selected by the Board herein created, and these 2 to select a 3rd person.

para.heading: Board decision final.
para.text: The decision of said board of arbitration or a majority of them shall be final and binding upon all parties to said appeal.

para.heading: Fee for arbitration costs.
para.text: A reasonable fee toward covering the cost of arbitration shall be paid by the appellant but shall be refunded if the appellant prevails.

para.heading: Fee.
para.text: The applicant shall pay the prescribed examination fee and shall appear before the Board at the time and place fixed by the Board. Any applicant who fails to appear for a scheduled examination is subject to filing a new application and the payment of the fee.

para.heading: When held.
para.text: Examinations for master, master restricted, or maintenance electricians shall be held on or about the 2nd Saturday of April and October.
The examination will consist of written questions in practical electricity and the Baltimore City and National Electric Codes.
A grade of 70% is required for passing.
An applicant who fails to pass an initial examination is eligible for any succeeding examination.
An applicant who fails to pass 2 or more examinations is not eligible for another examination within 12 months from the date of the last failed examination.
Separate applications and examination fees are required for each examination.

para.heading: Persons providing services to public.
para.text: Any person, firm, or corporation who does not hold a master electrician license and rendering a service to the public to maintain, service, and/or repair any kind of electrically operated or controlled equipment, etc., must have at least 1 representative licensed as a maintenance electrician who is responsible to the Board for all employees under his supervision.

Any person, firm, or corporation doing its own maintenance, service, and/or repairs, on its own premises, must have at least 1 representative so licensed who is responsible to the Board for all employees working under his or their supervision.

Premises requiring a licensed representative unless they hold a master electrician license are: factories, industrial plants, department stores, theatres, public halls, office buildings, apartment houses, schools, arenas, and any other occupancy (other than private dwelling houses, doing their own maintenance service, and/or repairs) doing its own maintenance, service, and/or repairs.
Each license so issued shall designate which kinds of apparatus or equipment the licensed representative is qualified to maintain, service and/or repair.

para.heading: Required.
para.text: Every person, firm, or corporation before receiving a master electrician's license shall make, execute, and deliver to said Board a good and sufficient bond to be approved by said Board, in the name of the City of Baltimore, in the sum of $2,500, the bond to be conditioned upon the faithful performance of any and all work entered upon or contracted for by said master electrician, and to save harmless the owner, or real party in interest in the property for which any such material is furnished, or services performed against loss, damage, and injury which shall arise through want of skill, or through the failure to use suitable or proper material in the performance of any work contracted for or undertaken by said master electrician, or his or its agents or employees.

para.heading: Limitations period.
para.text: An action may be maintained thereon in the name of such owner or real party in interest only if commenced within 1 year from and after the date of the installation of the materials furnished or performance of such work or service.

para.heading: "Grandfathers".
para.text: Those licensees who are automatically "grandfathered" into City licensing from state licensing have 10 days from the date thereof (May 1, 1983 or July 1, 1983) within which to file the required bond, and their City license is valid during this period.

para.heading: Initial issuance.
para.text: The first master, master restricted, or maintenance electrician's license will be issued to a successful applicant upon payment of the proper license fee and receipt of a signed license application form.
Renewals may be obtained by an application to the Board and payment of the renewal fee during a period of 3 months preceding the expiration of the license.

All persons registered as electricians in Baltimore City on April 30, 1983, and on June 30, 1983, are automatically licensed under this subtitle for the period May 1, 1983, or July 1, 1983, through December 31, 1983, without payment of a fee, and are subject to all its applicable provisions.

A licensee who holds a valid electrical license from the Board may be classified as inactive status, during which time he shall not install, maintain, service, or repair electrical wires, conductors, or apparatus for heat, light, or power purposes.
The licensee may retain his license on an inactive basis upon payment of an annual renewal fee.
A bond must be secured in order for the licensee to return to active status.
All licenses expire as of January 1 of each year, and are subject to a renewal fee.
Any person, firm, or corporation who desires to renew a license after the expiration date but prior to March 1 will be subject to a payment of a delinquent fee of $35.

Any person, firm, or corporation who fails to renew a license by March 1 of any year shall be treated as a new applicant and will be subjected to the same exam as new applicants and be required to pay the same fees.

Any person, firm, or corporation which renews its license between January 1, 1984 and March 1, 1984 shall not be subject to a renewal fee and shall not be required to take the same examination as a new applicant.

para.text: The following charges shall be made:

section.heading: Display of license.
section.text: Any and all persons granted a license or renewal of same shall display the same in a conspicuous place in the office or place of business of such licensee.

section.heading: License not assignable.
section.text: No license or renewal of same granted or issued under the provisions of this subtitle shall be assignable or transferable, and every license and renewal of same shall specify the name of the person, firm, or corporation to whom it is issued, and in the case of a corporation, the principal officer or the designated representatives of said corporation, through whom the application for the said license was made.

section.heading: Suspensions and revocations.
section.text: The Board shall have full power to suspend for not more than 90 days or revoke for proper cause any license or renewal of the same after a full hearing of all parties in interest.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: Nothing in this subtitle shall be construed to prevent any person from doing or performing the kinds of work of master, master restricted, or maintenance electrician, as herein defined, provided that such work is performed under the direction and supervision of a duly licensed master or maintenance electrician; but no such work shall be performed excepting under such direction and supervision of a duly licensed master or maintenance electrician, and the said licensed electrician shall be responsible for any and all work so done under his direction and supervision.

para.heading: Exceptions under law.
para.text: The provisions of this subtitle shall not apply:
to journeymen electricians or apprentices while such journeymen or apprentices are practicing their trade of journeymen electrician or apprentice; nor
to any public service companies subject to regulation by the Public Service Commission.

section.heading: Penalties.
section.text: Any person, firm, or corporation who shall practice or engage or continue in the work of a master or maintenance electrician without having complied with all the provisions of this subtitle, and any person not licensed as master or maintenance electrician who shall do or perform any such work except under the direction of a master or maintenance electrician, and any person having been licensed as a master or maintenance electrician and who shall fail to renew his license as herein provided and shall do or perform any such work, or who shall violate any of the provisions of this subtitle, shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and, upon conviction thereof, shall be sentenced to pay a fine of not less than $25 nor more than $500 or to an imprisonment not exceeding 90 days, or both, in the discretion of the Court, and any such conviction shall ipso facto revoke and annul any license that may have been issued to such person.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: In this subtitle, the following terms have the meanings indicated.

para.heading: Commissioner.
para.text: "Commissioner" means the Commissioner of Housing and Community Development or the Commissioner's designee.

para.heading: On-site utility contractor.
para.text: "On-site utility contractor" means any person doing or contracting to do any on-site utility work.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: "On-site utility work" means the installation of and operations on a building sanitary sewer, building storm water sewer, or water service pipe, and any of their appurtenances, on premises:
from the connection at the property line or, for private water and sewage disposal systems, from the connection at the well or septic tank,
to:
a point at least 5 feet from the foundation wall of any structure on the property; or
if the foundation wall is within 5 feet of the property line, to the foundation wall.

para.heading: Exclusions.
para.text: "On-site utility work" does not include a single utility connection for a 1-family dwelling.

annotations.annotation: For the Code-wide standard definition of “person”, see City General Provisions Article, § 1-107.

para.heading: Board established.
para.text: There is an On-Site Utility Contractors Board of Baltimore City.

para.heading: Composition.
para.text: The Board consists of the following 5 members:
the Commissioner or designee;
the Director of Construction and Buildings Inspection or designee;
the Director of Public Works or designee;
a member, appointed by the Mayor, who is an on-site utility contractor licensed by the City and resides in or has a place of business in the City; and
a member, appointed by the Mayor, who is a master plumber licensed by the State, has at least 2 years' experience in utility construction, and resides in or has a place of business in the City.

para.heading: Appointments to be nonpartisan.
para.text: Appointments to the Board are to be made without regard to the appointee's political affiliation.

para.heading: Compensation; expenses.
para.text: The appointed members of the Board:
serve without compensation; but
are entitled to reimbursement for reasonable expenses incurred in the performance of their duties, as provided in the Ordinance of Estimates.

para.heading: Board chair.
para.text: The Commissioner serves as the Board's chair.

section.heading: General authority of Board.
section.text: To safeguard the health and safety of the people of the City, the Board may:

para.text: subject to Title 4 {"Administrative Procedure Act – Regulations"} of the City General Provisions Article, adopt rules, regulations, and specifications governing the qualification and licensing of on-site utility contractors in the City;
develop and administer examinations to test an applicant's knowledge of on-site utility work, if the Board considers testing necessary in a particular case;
accept applications for licensure as an on-site utility contractor;
issue, deny, suspend, and revoke licenses as necessary or appropriate; and
hold hearings on proposed denials, suspensions, and revocations.

annotations.annotation: By authority of Ordinance 20-431, Section 5, the Director of Legislative Reference, in consultation with the Law Department, has conformed item (1) to refer expressly to the requirements of the recently-enacted Administrative Procedure Act that, effective January 15, 2021, governs the proposal, adoption, and publication of administrative rules and regulations.

section.heading: Health Commissioner to consult.
section.text: The Commissioner of Health or the Commissioner's representative must consult with the Board as necessary from time to time.

section.heading: License required.
section.text: No person may perform or directly supervise any on-site utility work in the City unless licensed to do so under this subtitle.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: The license may be issued only to an individual and not to a firm or corporation.

para.heading: Company representatives.
para.text: For every firm or corporation doing or contracting to do on-site utility work, a license must be obtained:
by at least 1 member of the firm or 1 officer of the corporation; and
by every on-site supervisor of the on-site utility work.

para.heading: Board to set.
para.text: An applicant for a license must furnish evidence satisfactory to the Board that the applicant meets the qualifications set by the Board.

para.heading: Minimum standards.
para.text: These qualifications must:
be comparable to the prequalification criteria set for contractors in Baltimore City and neighboring jurisdictions; and
include, but not be limited to, at least 2 years' experience in the installation of building sanitary sewer, building storm water sewer, and water service pipe utilities.

para.heading: Additional considerations.
para.text: The Board may consider, but not give conclusive weight to, the fact that an applicant:
possesses a current on-site utility contractor's license, or its equivalent, issued by another political subdivision of this State; or
is an officer or employee of a firm or corporation currently prequalified with the City to perform Category B utilities construction work.

para.heading: Required.
para.text: Before any person may be issued an on-site utility contractors license, the person must deliver to the Commissioner a good and sufficient bond satisfactory to the Commissioner, in the name of the City of Baltimore.

para.heading: Amount and tenor.
para.text: The bond must be:
for the amount of $2,500; and
conditioned on:
the contractor's faithful performance of all work done or contracted for by the on-site utility contractor; and

the contractor's indemnifying and saving harmless the City and the owner or real party in interest of the property for which any material is furnished or services performed against loss, failure to use suitable material, or failure to properly perform any work contracted for or undertaken by the contractor and any agent or employee of the contractor.

para.heading: Limit of liability.
para.text: An action may be maintained on the bond only if it is brought within 1 year after the date of the installation of the material or performance of the work or service.

para.heading: Fee.
para.text: The license fee is $150, payable at the time of application.

para.heading: Term.
para.text: The license expires annually on December 31.

section.heading: Renewal of license.
section.text: A license may be renewed annually, on or before December 31, on payment of a renewal fee of $150.

para.heading: License non-assignable.
para.text: A license issued under this subtitle is neither assignable nor transferrable.

para.heading: Single-company representation.
para.text: A licensee may represent only 1 firm or corporation at any one time.

para.heading: Reinstatement allowed.
para.text: Any person who allows his or her license to lapse may apply for reinstatement and, at the discretion of the Board, may be reinstated on payment of the renewal fee.

para.heading: 6-month limit.
para.text: However, after a lapse of 6 months or more, the former licensee will be treated as a new applicant, subject to the same requirements as new applicants.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: The Board may suspend or revoke an on-site utility contractors license or deny the renewal of a license for just cause.

para.heading: Just cause.
para.text: Just cause for suspension, revocation, or denial includes, but is not limited to:
failure to provide the required bond;
violation of any material provision of the Building, Fire, and Related Codes Article or of any other board, City, State, or federal law, ordinance, rule, or regulation;
unsatisfactory work or negligence, incompetence, or misconduct in the performance of on-site utility work;
fraud, deceit, or misrepresentation in the performance of any work or in obtaining or renewing a license, permit, or bond;
selling, lending, or otherwise permitting any improper use of a license or permit; or
failure to notify the Board of current address.

para.heading: Board to provide.
para.text: Before suspending, revoking, or denying the renewal of a license, the Board must provide the licensee with an opportunity for a hearing on the matter.

para.heading: Notice.
para.text: At least 5 days before the hearing, the Board must notify the licensee, by certified or registered mail, of:
the nature of the alleged violation; and
the time and place of the hearing.
The Board must issue a written decision, stating its reasons, within 10 days of the hearing.
In its decision, the Board may order that the license be:
suspended for a specified term of up to 90 days;
suspended indefinitely, until the licensee gives evidence satisfactory to the Board that the condition for which the license was suspended has been corrected and will not recur;
revoked, in which case application for reinstatement may not be made until 6 months after the revocation;
not renewed under the same conditions as those specified above for a suspension or revocation; or
continued in full force.

section.heading: Enforcement.
section.text: In addition to any other remedy provided in this subtitle or otherwise by law, this subtitle may be enforced by the Commissioner in the manner provided in § 104{"Duties and powers of Building Official"} of the Baltimore City Building Code.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: Any person who violates any provision of this subtitle is guilty of a misdemeanor and, on conviction, is subject to a fine of not more than $500 for each violation.

para.heading: Each day a separate offense.
para.text: Each day that a violation continues is a separate offense.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: In this subtitle, the following terms have the meanings indicated.

para.heading: Commissioner.
para.text: "Commissioner" means the Commissioner of Housing and Community Development or the Commissioner's designee.

para.heading: Service provider.
para.text: "Service provider" means any person doing business in this City as:
a master plumber;
a gas fitter;
a heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, or refrigeration contractor; or
a home improvement contractor.

annotations.annotation: For the Code-wide standard definition of “person”, see City General Provisions Article, § 1-107.

section.heading: Registration required.
section.text: Every service provider must:

para.text: register with the Commissioner;
provide the Commissioner with:
the address of his or her place of business; and
the name under which the business is carried on; and
give immediate notice to the Commissioner of any change in that information.

section.heading: Registration fees.
section.text: For the registration of a service provider under this subtitle, the fee is as $25.

section.heading: Penalties.
section.text: Any person who violates any provision of this subtitle is guilty of a misdemeanor and, on conviction, is subject to a fine of not more than $500 for each violation.
